comments.body: this seems a bit dangerous, re path transversal

Agree, but there's precedent in other places here and elsewhere.

I'd be willing to swap something else in if shown a better pattern.

Discussed with @elsonrodriguez on Slack but running with this I got:

openstack: 'stack' is not an openstack command. See 'openstack --help'.
Did you mean one of these?
backup create
backup delete
backup list
backup restore
backup show

It seems like if you are relying on the heat related commands being there you need a more recent version of **python-openstackclient** (2.4.0) than I had so maybe a version check is needed? The version needed is mentioned in the provided documentation ( https://github.com/FujitsuEnablingSoftwareTechnologyGmbH/kubernetes.github.io/blob/openstack-provider-doc/docs/getting-started-guides/openstack-heat.md ) but it seems like the **verify-prereqs** step should catch this?

@elsonrodriguez why do we need this specific **python-openstackclient** version?

Are there any restrictions with more recent versions of the client?
@elsonrodriguez yeah, I plan to create a PR for a check shortly after this lands.
